channel.title: math.KT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.KT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: The uniqueness theorem for Kasparov theory
item.description: arXiv:2601.23029v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Answering a question of Carri\'on et al in their recent landmark paper on C*-algebra classification, we prove a general uniqueness theorem for $KK$-theory. Given arbitrary separable C*-algebras $A$ and $B$ and a Cuntz pair consisting of two absorbing representations $\varphi,\psi: A\to\mathcal{M}(B\otimes\mathcal{K})$, the induced element of $KK(A,B)$ vanishes if and only if $\varphi$ and $\psi$ are strongly asymptotically unitarily equivalent. This improves upon the Lin-Dadarlat-Eilers stable uniqueness theorem. The conclusion is deduced by first showing the $K_1$-injectivity of an auxiliary C*-algebra associated to the C*-pair $(A,B)$, which is sometimes called the Paschke dual algebra in the literature. Most of the article is concerned with the treatment of an umbrella theorem, which yields such a uniqueness theorem for other variants of $KK$-theory. This encompasses nuclear $KK$-theory, ideal-related $KK$-theory, equivariant $KK$-theory, or any combinations thereof.
item.dc:creator: G\'abor Szab\'o

item.title: Asymptotic vanishing of cohomology in triangulated categories
item.description: arXiv:2405.12763v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Given a graded-commutative ring acting centrally on a triangulated category, our main result shows that if cohomology of a pair of objects of the triangulated category is finitely generated over the ring acting centrally, then the asymptotic vanishing of the cohomology is well-behaved. In particular, enough consecutive asymptotic vanishing of cohomology implies all eventual vanishing. Several key applications are also given.
item.dc:creator: Petter Andreas Bergh, David A. Jorgensen, Peder Thompson

item.title: A linearization map for genuine equivariant algebraic $K$-theory
item.description: arXiv:2309.08025v4 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We introduce a version of algebraic $K$-theory for coefficient systems of rings which is valued in genuine $G$-spectra for a finite group $G$. We use this construction to build a genuine $G$-spectrum $K_G(\mathbb{Z}[\underline{\pi_1(X)}])$ associated to a $G$-space $X$, which provides a home for equivariant versions of classical invariants like the Wall finiteness obstruction and Whitehead torsion. We provide a comparison between our $K$-theory spectrum and the equivariant $A$-theory of Malkiewich--Merling via a genuine equivariant linearization map.
item.dc:creator: Maxine Calle, David Chan, Andres Mejia
